column4: I don't know what is mezzo, but that kind of thing is the top reason why many prefer windows instead of linux: linux is a great OS, as long as you are happy with those apps included in your distro (so they are easy to "sudo aptitude install appname"). But as soon as you want to run some app that is NOT part of your distro, you begin to see what's wrong with today's linux distros (this *could* be corrected with the correct attitude !), so it is
NOT a fundamental error in linux, it is just bad decisions when implementing ...
if he's not already running KDE, then installing KDE applications is asking for more resources/potential problems then is needed. Especially for someone with pre-existing issues.
I didn't say it wasn't possible
